title: ğŸ‰ Congratulations on Your Selection!
text:
Welcome to the ACM India Summer School 2025 on AI for Social Good at IIT Gandhinagar. Below are essential details to help you prepare for your participation.




You will be provided hostel accommodation on campus.
Check-in: 01 June 2025
Check-out: 14 June 2025
No accommodation charge â€“ included in the program.
Meals: Breakfast, lunch, and dinner will be provided on campus.








Component
Amount




Application Fee
â‚¹150 + 18% GST


Program Fee (on selection)
â‚¹3000 + 18% GST


Accommodation & Meals
Included


Travel
Self-arranged








Government ID card (for hostel check-in)
Laptop with Python installed
Notebook, pens, charger, power bank
Comfortable clothing for Gujarat heat
Water bottle, umbrella, etc.
Toiletries (soap, shampoo, etc.)
Any personal items you may need
Enthusiasm to learn and collaborate!






Railway Stations: Depending on your train, you may be able to choose:

Gandhinagar Capital (GNC)
Sabarmati Junction (SBI)
Ahmedabad Junction (ADI)

Nearest Airport: Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport (AMD) (~20 km)
From Ahmedabad, take a cab or bus to IIT Gandhinagar, Palaj Campus


ğŸ—ºï¸ IIT Gandhinagar Address:
Indian Institute of Technology Gandhinagar,
Palaj, Gandhinagar â€“ 382055, Gujarat





Q. Can I arrive a day earlier or stay a day later?
No, accommodation is only available from 01 June to 14 June.
Q. Can I change to another school?
No.Â Once selected, switching is not allowed.
Q. Will I get a certificate?
Yes. Full attendance is required for certification.
Q. What if I have dietary restrictions? Please inform us in advance. We will do our best to accommodate your needs. We will be sharing a form for this.




Feel free to reach out:

Nipun Batra

We look forward to welcoming you to IIT Gandhinagar!

title: ğŸ¤ ACM India Summer School 2025 â€“ Speakers
text:
ğŸ¤ ACM India Summer School 2025 â€“ Speakers
ğŸ“ IIT Gandhinagar | ğŸ“† 02â€“13 June 2025


Prof.Â Rajat Moona
Director, IIT Gandhinagar
Opening the summer school with welcome remarks.



Prof.Â Anirban Dasgupta
Professor, IIT Gandhinagar
Co-coordinator. Focuses on algorithmic foundations of ML, fairness, and networks.



Prof.Â Nipun Batra
Associate Professor, IIT Gandhinagar
Co-coordinator. Works on AI for sustainability, air quality, and smart sensing.



Dr.Â Venkat Padmanabhan
Deputy Managing Director, Microsoft Research India
Keynote speaker. Leader in mobile systems and AI for societal impact.



Dr.Â Manish Gupta
Director, Google DeepMind India
Keynote speaker. Focused on ML at scale and social impact applications.



Dr.Â Jigar Doshi
Talks on AI for public health, agriculture, and climate sustainability.



Dr.Â Prasant Misra
Principal Scientist, TCS Research
Expert in mobile sensing and information processing at scale.



Dr.Â Shailesh Deshpande
Scientist, TCS Research
Remote sensing expert; also conducting optimization labs.



Prof.Â Udit Bhatia
Assistant Professor, IIT Gandhinagar
Expert in physics-guided ML, floods, and networked infrastructure.



Prof.Â Shanmuganathan Raman
Professor, IIT Gandhinagar
Specializes in vision-based AI including pose estimation.



Prof.Â Krishna Prasad
Associate Professor, IIT Gandhinagar
Researches Brain-Computer Interfaces and neuro-AI.



Prof.Â Manisha Padala
Assistant Professor, IIT Gandhinagar
Works on fairness in federated learning and adversarial ML.



Dr.Â Vaibhav Rajan
Scientist, Google DeepMind
Talks on ML for personalized cancer treatment and biomedical AI.



Prof.Â Sayan Ranu
Professor, IIT Delhi
Works on graph neural networks, GNN condensation, and pollution monitoring.



Dr.Â Mohit Jain
Researcher, Microsoft Research India
Focuses on HCI and AI applications in healthcare and inclusion.



Prof.Â Pallavi Bharadwaj
Assistant Professor, IIT Gandhinagar
Works on sustainable mobility and electric vehicles.



Prof.Â Yogesh Kumar Meena
Assistant Professor, IIT Gandhinagar
Specialist in accessibility technologies and inclusive design.



Prof.Â Vaibhav Tripathi
Assistant Professor, IIT Gandhinagar
Explores connectome-based predictive modeling and brain imaging.



Dr.Â Rishiraj Adhikary / Niladri
Jio Platforms
Talk on AI-driven solutions (exact topic TBD).



Alok Talekar
Researcher, Google DeepMind India
Lectures and labs on advanced AI techniques (topics TBD).



Prof.Â Manish Jain
Professor, IIT Gandhinagar (CCL Lab)
Teaches on meta-learning and â€œlearning to learn.â€



Prof.Â Tavpritesh Sethi
Associate Professor, IIIT Delhi
Causal modeling and AI for health system preparedness.



Dr.Â Bimal
ISRO SAC
Talk on satellite applications (topic TBD).

(More speaker details will be added as confirmed.)

title: ACM India Summer School 2025
text:
AI for Social Good â€¢ 11-Day Intensive Program
Hosted by IIT Gandhinagar â€¢ June 2-13, 2025
Apply Now | View Schedule


Join us for an intensive 11-day program exploring cutting-edge AI techniques applied to social good domains including healthcare, sustainability, and agriculture.
Our program combines expert talks, hands-on tutorials, and interactive panel discussions to foster both technical expertise and interdisciplinary collaboration.

title: ACM India Summer School 2025: AI for Social Good
text:
The ACM Summer School on AI for Social Good at IIT Gandhinagar offers an intensive 11-day program on AI techniques applied to social good domains such as healthcare, sustainability, and agriculture.
The school will feature expert talks, hands-on tutorials, and panel discussions, fostering both technical expertise and interdisciplinary collaboration.
